signpost[0]: go from one side to another
definition[0]: to go or stretch from one side of something such as a road, river, room etc to the other
example[0]: An old bridge crosses the river.
example[1]: It’s easy to have an accident just crossing the road.
example[2]: He was hit by a car when he tried to cross over the road near Euston station.
example[3]: the first steamship to cross the Atlantic
example[5]: She crossed over to sit beside Dot.
definition[1]: if you cross a line, track etc, you go over and beyond it
example[6]: He raised his arms in triumph as he crossed the line for his 100-metres win.
definition[2]: if two or more roads, lines, etc cross, or if one crosses another, they go across each other
example[7]: The by-pass crosses Wilton Lane shortly after a roundabout.
definition[3]: if you cross your legs, arms, or ankles, you put one on top of the other
example[8]: She was sitting on the floor with her legs crossed.
definition[4]: to mix two or more different breeds of animal or plant to form a new breed
example[9]: a flower produced by crossing several different varieties
example[10]: These cattle were crossed with a breed from the highlands.
definition[5]: to make someone angry by opposing their plans or orders
example[11]: He hated anyone who crossed him.
definition[6]: to kick, throw, or hit the ball across the playing area in a sport such as football, hockey etc
definition[7]: to draw two lines across a cheque to show that it must be paid into the bank account of the person whose name is on it
definition[8]: if two letters about the same subject cross in the post, each was sent before the other was received
definition[9]: a mixture of two things, breeds, or qualities
example[12]: The tour manager’s role is a cross between hostess and courier.
example[13]: Their dog is a cross between two well-known breeds.
definition[10]: a mark (x or +) used on paper, to represent where something is, or where something should be
example[14]: I’ve put a cross on the map to mark where our street is.
example[15]: Please sign your name by the cross.
definition[11]: a mark (x) used on paper to show that something that has been written or printed is not correct
example[16]: My homework got a lot more ticks than crosses.
definition[12]: a mark (x or +) used by someone who cannot write, in order to sign their name
definition[13]: the cross that Jesus Christ died on
example[17]: Christians believe that Jesus died on the cross for our sins.
definition[14]: an object, picture, or mark in the shape of a cross, used as a sign of the Christian faith or for decoration
example[18]: Pauline wore a tiny gold cross.
definition[15]: an upright post of wood with another crossing it near the top, that people in the past were fastened to with nails and left to die on as a punishment
definition[16]: a decoration in the shape of a cross that is given to someone as an honour, especially for military courage
example[19]: He was awarded the George Cross.
definition[17]: a kick or hit of the ball in a sport such as football, hockey etc, that goes across the field
definition[18]: a way of hitting someone in the sport of boxing, in which your arm goes over theirs as they try to hit you
example[20]: He caught his opponent with a right cross to the chin.
definition[19]: if you describe something as the cross that someone has to bear, you mean it is a problem that makes them very unhappy or worried, and that continues for a long time
example[21]: I feel sorry for you, but we all have our crosses to bear.
example[22]: She gets cross when he goes out drinking.
example[23]: Sometimes I get very cross with the children.
example[24]: She was cross at being interrupted.
definition[21]: going from one side to the other
example[25]: a cross-Channel ferry  (=sailing from Britain to France)
definition[22]: going between two things and joining them
definition[23]: to draw two lines and write the words ‘account payee’ on a cheque, showing that it can only be paid into a bank account of the person named on the cheque, and not exchanged for cash or paid into a different account
